data.title: Nice surprise but expensive
data.text: I live in Columbia and have been wanting to try this restaurant for years.  Not sure why it took so long but we went there on short notice last weekend.  Cute restaurant.  Service was really good.  Food was mixed, some items we had were great while others not that good.  Prices were really high though so not sure that I'd go back.  There are other restaurants in Columbia in that price range which are much, much better.

data.title: So Little Food for So Much Money
data.text: This is a very nice restaurant setting, especially for wine lovers.  The décor is unique and tasteful, the live music sets the tone for a pleasant dining experience and the food and wine are very good.  But, if you are very hungry, you will leave unsatisfied and much lighter in the wallet.

data.title: very nice -  great wine selection
data.text: This is a cozy place with a wine barrel and corks decor (which works for a unique ambiance).  The food ( I has the brisket with noodles) was quite good. My friends had salmon which they said was excellent (though portion size is small). Unless you have a huge appetite I highly recommend Wine Cellar

data.title: Great Food and Wine!
data.text: Attended a private event at this establishment, service was spot on and the selection of wine and before dinner drinks was wonderful. Be sure to try the salad with the cashew dressing and the filet...yum!

data.title: Civilized sophistication
data.text: Enjoyed an elegant, yet not pretentious lunch. Food is farm to table, delicious options. Bonus, all dishes can be ordered half sized for lunch, add a small salad and get a gourmet repast for $15-ish. Inviting ambiance, friendly service, great wine choices.

data.title: Really lives up to its name!
data.text: Two couples recently went to this restaurant on a Saturday night.  One of the impressive things was our waitress's knowledge concerning their wines.  I took her recommendation concerning a cabernet with which I was not familiar and was very pleased.  I had their brisket pappardelle and the others had a rib special-all were quite good and the servings were not overwhelming in size.  The salads were crisp and freshly prepared.  We had not been to this restaurant in a couple of years and were quite impressed.  We'll be back soon.

data.title: Nice small restaurant with lovely ambience
data.text: The wine cellar and bistro is a somewhat upscale eatery in Columbia (although, being a college town, casual dress is everywhere) with a great Wine list and excellent food. The tables are far enough apart that you can actually hear your dinner companion's voice, something that is increasingly hard to find. Sunday evenings are great for the budget conscious, since from 5-6 pm they have half off small plates and wine. You definitely need a reservation most of the time.

data.title: gourmet unique dining with great wine choices
data.text: This has been a top restaurant in columbia for years since the great chef Mr. Cyr started cooking here. Lots of seasonal choices and tons of wines in stock. My meal started with the fresh oysters on the half shell. Many of the appetizers could be an entree and are half price on thursday's at happy hour. Several items are highlighted because they are local and seasonal making the menu fresh and green and favoring local organic mini farmers. Each entree is a creation with unbelievable variation that changes constantly. This is my go-to always special fun to eat at restaurant in Columbia. Surprise yourself and visit it for a culinary treat.

data.title: Cool Atmosphere
data.text: This is a great place for romantic dinner for two, or special occasions for all.   Unique menu, very good food and great wine selections

data.title: Lovely celebration dinner; excellent food.
data.text: Visited here with friends to celebrate a graduation.  My friends made their reservations 6 months out, and it was worth it.  The wine was wonderful, the entrees were excellent, and the chocolate fondue for dessert was even more decadent than it sounds.  Excellent service, loved the piano music, a hidden treasure in Columbia.

data.title: Excellent graduating dinner
data.text:
Another fantastic meal at the wine cellar! The goat cheese truffles and the crab crepes were amazing.  Our waitress suggested a very nice bottle of wine. I especially like the fact they do not try and sell you the most expensive wines. Our main dishes were delicious. We had a  wide variety of dishes including chicken ravioli, lamp meat loaf and brisket stroganoff.

All of the employees are very friendly and enjoy taking care of their guests.

This restaurant is one of the few that takes reservations in Como!

data.title: Absolutely exquisite food and service
data.text: I'm not easily impressed, but this is easily the best food I have ever eaten in Columbia, MO. I have never eaten one thing out of their kitchen that hasn't been superb. The service is truly fantastic and the ambiance is cozy and rustic. It is expensive, but if you are on a budget they do have a fabulous happy hour from 5-6 where several dishes are half priced, as well as drink specials. If you enjoy a bubbly cocktail, the garden lavender is heavenly. I have to pause after every bite of food here, it's really that good. This is not a family restaurant, but for a special date it would be perfect. I really can't say enough good things about this restaurant.

data.title: Just passing through
data.text:
I was looking for a place with a nice wine selection and unique bites. A quick search provided this location and after a look at the online menu and wine list I decided to give it a try.

The Smoked Carrot Bisque with chestnuts and a dusting of chipotle powder was divine. I got a cup and wish I would have gotten a bowl. And the olive oil for dipping was exquisite, so much so that I bought a bottle to take with me. The tuna entrée with the root vegetables was wonderful as well.

Having a Cruvinet wine system for by-the-glass service is a mark of a quality wine bar. Wine as it should taste, not having to worry if you get a 3-day or more open bottle that mars the tasting experience. Additionally the service was great, the live piano music and the overall atmosphere would make me a regular if I lived in Columbia.

data.title: Yummmm - culinary treats
data.text: A small place - good for intimate dining and friendly gathering with a bit of leisure.  Excellent selection of wines to compliment the seasonal selections that change weekly.  Service is very good and welcoming.  Hard to recommend one dish because indeed the dishes change.  The menu is not huge but there is usually a vegetarian, meat, and fish selection in addition to properly proportioned salads and appetizers as well as a few delectable desserts.  I am a local so the 'travel date' is a 'last ate at' date.

data.title: Top shelf!
data.text: This is a stunningly good restaurant and would be great in whatever city it was located. The menu was filled with delights and the wine selection was very good and moderately priced. The coconut curry scallop appetizer, cheese board and warm goat cheese truffle apps were amazing! I had the duck and elderberry sauce main course which was delicious while others raved about the brisket & pappardelle stroganoff as well as the blackened scallops and dirty rice. The deserts looked amazing but we did an extra bottle of wine instead and no regrets!

data.title: huge wine selection and eclectic adventurous and creative menu.
data.text: if you are after a creative, fun, and delicious menu selection this is the place. Also a huge selection of reasonable wines from all over the world. The chef here puts all sorts of food combinations together that I have not seen anywhere else and makes them work for an amazing array of items. I attended the mushroom and wine tasting which is just one of the special events they host all year. Before the tasting I enjoyed the scallop salad with an amazing dressing and lots of condiments which made it fabulous. This is a friendly and comfortable fun place for a dinner with extraordinary fine food and drinks.

data.title: the wine cellar
data.text: A hidden gem in Columbia. Well curated wine list, including several organic options. Diverse, interesting menu. Impeccable service. Cozy, rustic decor. Adorable patio when weather permits.

data.title: Great restaurant
data.text: I was helping my daughter move cross country from Washington, D.C. To Seattle. Both of us are vegetarian foodies and I have a dairy allergy as well. It was fun and challenging to come up with places we wanted to eat. This was the best restaurant on our trip. I had a great martini made from a local gin, some of the best food and most creative dishes I've eaten anywhere and a wonderful wine flight with some very good wines. The entire back of the menu were dishes made with items grown in their newly certified organic garden. A true farm to table experience. There were also numerous meat, poultry and fish choices that also looked quite creative. This was a real find.  The staff was friendly and the service prompt. We couldn't have asked for a better dining experience.

data.title: Finally! A good restaurant in Columbia.
data.text: Growing up in Columbia, I frequently heard the lament from visitors to the University that "there were no good restaurants in Columbia." After I moved away and experienced truly good restaurants in various cities, I had to agree. That yawning gap is finally filled with the Wine Cellar and Bistro. The portions were correct, the food sumptuous, the jazz interesting, the wine so good that my companion and I each took a bottle home. The service started a little rocky, but the restaurant self corrected and Caleb the waiter was perfect. They use local fare to full advantage. Do not miss the Chocolate Fondue dessert.

data.title: Great local establishment with unique preparations!
data.text: We made reservations for a large party and we were not disappointed in our choice. Our servers were very welcoming, they had good knowledge of the menu choices, and they were extremely efficient. The restaurant has a "farm to table" section of the menu that includes items from their own garden as well as local purveyors and everything on it was creatively prepared and delicious. The cheese board was especially impressive with local cheeses and it had an excellent price point for the quality and quantity of the offerings. Wine list is varied and there are numerous selections by the glass. Would definitely dine there again when visiting Columbia!
